articles.title: WHO: Herd immunity for the coronavirus is a 'dangerous concept' - The Telegraph
articles.description: Herd immunity is an epidemiological term usually reserved to describe how the population as a whole is protected from a disease
articles.content:
The World Health Organisation has condemned the "dangerous" concept of herd immunity for Covid-19.
Herd immunity is an epidemiological term usually reserved to describe how the population as a whole is protected from a disease depending on the levels of peop… [+885 chars]

articles.author: Rob Merrick
articles.title: Boris Johnson's lockdown easing measures 'dangerous' and more epidemics inevitable, Independent Sage warns - The Independent
articles.description: 'We shall inevitably see a more rapid return of local epidemics and face the prospect of further partial or national lockdowns'
articles.content:
A group of independent scientists has branded Boris Johnsons easing of the lockdown dangerous and warned that further local Covid-19 epidemics are inevitable.
Its report accuses the prime minister of not following the science as work and society are graduall… [+2990 chars]

articles.author: Gemma Mullin
articles.title: Coronavirus symptoms in kids DON’T always start with a cough and could be sickness or diarrhoea - The Sun
articles.content:
CORONAVIRUS symptoms in kids don't always start with a cough, a new study has found.
Experts claim that sickness and diarrhoea should also be considered an early warning sign of Covid-19 in children.
 Experts say coronavirus symptoms in children don't alway… [+3737 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Earlier Scottish lockdown 'could have prevented 2,000 deaths' - BBC News
articles.description: Scientists suggest that earlier action could have reduced the Covid-19 death rate in Scotland by about 80%.
articles.content:
Image caption
 Dougie Chambers and Andy and Mary Leaman all died after contracting Covid-19
More than 2,000 coronavirus deaths could have been prevented if Scotland had locked down two weeks earlier, according to a new study.
A team of epidemiological scie… [+6949 chars]

articles.author: Neil Shaw
articles.title: Ticket office worker dies of Covid-19 after being spat at on duty - Wales Online
articles.description: A man spat and coughed at two workers - both fell ill within days
articles.content:
A railway ticket office worker has died of coronavirus after being spat at while on duty.
Belly Mujinga, 47, was on the concourse of Victoria station in London in March when a member of the public who said he had Covid-19 spat and coughed at her and a collea… [+1931 chars]

articles.author: Watford Observer Staff
articles.title: NHS tracing app 'does not work on some Huawei mobiles and older phones' - Watford Observer
articles.description: Some new Huawei phones and some older mobiles cannot run the NHS contact tracing app being trialled on the Isle of Wight, NHSX has said.
articles.content:
Some new Huawei phones and some older mobiles cannot run the NHS contact tracing app being trialled on the Isle of Wight, NHSX has said.
Dr Geraint Lewis, who is in charge of the development of the NHS Covid-19 app, said that the new tool will only work with… [+4229 chars]
